workers vote against the deal. Vote-casting at the factory, which employs around 5,500 people, began on Thursday evening and ended Friday around 1830 GMT. Voting turnout was put at 96 percent. The voting slips that have been slipped into the factory's ballot boxes since yesterday are destined to change the country's industrial history, Silvio Berlusconi Sole 24 Ore business paper said in an editorial on Friday. Donald Rumsfeld 's retrospective reinforces earlier accounts of a dysfunctional National Security Council riven by tensions between the Pentagon and State Department. Addressing charges that he failed to provide enough troops in Iraq, he allows that, In retrospect, there may have been times when more troops could have helped. But he insists senior military officers never informed him if they had reservations about the size of the invading force.
